result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Timothy J Morgan in court.  Attorney Brett A Ekes in court for Timothy J Morgan.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Brett Ekes

Adjustment Number: 22A 329409,

Amount: $20.00

Defendant Timothy J Morgan in court.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF989 & 22CM511

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH D.L.M. dob 8-31-1973 or RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Right to Attorney

Defendant Timothy J Morgan in court. State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 2:00 p.m. Appearances made. Record by Atty. Berg taht they will be charging DC, but are waiting for City of Lake Geneva to sign the complaint. Court addresses the defendant who wishes to waive his attorney. Clerk provides wavier of attorney form to the defendant to fill out, and will recall the case when it is completed. 
Recalled @ 2:08 p.m. - Court goes over waiver form with the defendant and finds waiver to be knowing, voluntary, and intelligent. Court sets matter on intake calendar for complaint to be filed. 
Court in recess.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Timothy J Morgan in court. Samuel Berg for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
